Dialog.text: You've got me really curious.
Unhhhhh... Dr. Yu? What happened? Where...
Dialog.notes: [Rani Chaudhary] Groggy and badly shaken. Has just been released from having her mind dominated. {Relieved, then disgusted}

Dialog.text: Oh god, please tell me you killed that - thing.
This is Fowles.
Dialog.notes: (Maliah Fowles.) Holy shit, Alex called me.

Dialog.text: Uh... yes, of course, sir. It's just that normally I can't do something like that without consent from Chief Elazar, HR, and another director.
Dialog.notes: (Maliah Fowles.) Trying to keep it together, the big boss just called her personally.

Dialog.text: Yes sir. I understand.
If you hadn't come along... I'd still be at their mercy. Thank you.
Dialog.notes: [Rani Chaudhary] confused and disoriented. Survived a telepath.

Dialog.text: Hope the E.A.T.s from the Arboretum were useful. On full auto, they should tear those creatures to pieces.
Did you follow all the steps on the launch card exactly?
Hang on... I'm looking at the schematics. There should be a remote sensor on the explosive bolts...
Dialog.notes: (Alika James) A little slow, distracted as she's relaying what she's finding on a diagram

Dialog.text: I see all the leads, but... wait. This can't be right...
Dialog.notes: (Alika James) Still distracted. to herself almost.

Dialog.text: Uh... no, I don't think so. Is there a manual crank of some sort?
Dialog.notes: (Alika James) No idea what's going on

Dialog.text: Hey. A little bird told me you plugged a leak in an unconventional manner a few weeks ago.
Maybe. Care to elaborate?
Worse. I'll dunk you in the eel tank.
Ingenious. Next time let's make sure we have enough spare parts to do the job right.
Are you on your way?
Octavia! Didn't you see the alert? We're supposed to muster.
I don't think this a drill, Octavia. I'm sending you the code. Please. Come to the escape pods right now.
I'll log everything on the security computer.
Yes, sir.
This better not get us into trouble. Not too much trouble, anyway.
Oh - well, I don't need a key for that.
And what if I bump into Julien Howard?
Probably be a lot less grumpy...
Dialog.notes: (Elle Gold) Almost under her breath. Implied: "...if he let someone touch his fruit."

Dialog.text: Remmer? Remmer, do you copy?
I came up here to deploy the E.A.Ts... the Eradicator turrets...
then it was like all the color bled from the world... everything had an... edge to it. I couldn't control myself... I...
But... the E.A.Ts. are still in the small arms closet nearby, we could still use them. Here's the code.
I'm going to make my way to the Cargo Bay. Security was supposed to fall back there.
Sarah will have my ass if I don't.
Really, Dr. Yu, I'm fine - just need a moment.
Thanks again. I owe you my life. And my mind.
Dialog.notes: [Rani Chaudhary] slightly quieter at the end

Dialog.text: My brain feels... like it needs a shower. A hundred showers.
My vision's a bit blurry, but I'm doing better.
If anyone ever says a bad word about you, I'll knock them silly.
Did you find the E.A.T.s? I hope they shred those things.
I'm going to head to the Cargo Bay, see if I can rendezvous with the other survivors there.
I'm going to head to the Cargo Bay. Don't want to make Sarah mad.
Even if she didn't make it, she'll still find a way to take it out on me.
Being controlled by those things... it was like I was watching myself, but my voice... my voice was buried inside me.
Dialog.notes: [Rani Chaudhary] Trying to find the words

Dialog.text: I wanted to scream, but I couldn't even do that - I felt like I was drowning... in myself.
I heard that some of the other security officers... Teague, Remmer... they didn't make it.
There must be some way out of this.
There's still hope. There must be.
Where did those things come from?
...although I'm glad the E.A.T. rounds were designed not to penetrate the hull.
I... was up in the Arboretum because... well, Sarah asked me to keep an eye on your brother and his visitors. Let her know if I noticed anyone or anything... odd.
Talk about an understatement.
We were almost set to arrest your brother, when... the attack happened.
Are you doing all right?
Really, I'm fine. I'm glad you came along when you did.
Dialog.notes: [Rani Chaudhary] Beat after "I'm Fine" then a little softer.

Dialog.text: What are you doing?!
Dialog.notes: [Rani Chaudhary] Player has become hostile to the Security Officers

Dialog.text: Stop! Dr. Yu, stop!
Dialog.notes: [Rani Chaudhary] Player has become hostile to the Security Officers
[Rani Chaudhary] Guesses that aliens are controlling the player based on her own experience.

Dialog.text: She must be being controlled!
Dialog.notes: [Rani Chaudhary] Guesses that aliens are controlling the player based on her own experience.

Dialog.text: He must be being controlled!
Dialog.notes: [Rani Chaudhary] Guesses that aliens are controlling the player based on her own experience.

Dialog.text: Oh my god, Dr. Yu's one of them!
Dialog.notes: [Rani Chaudhary] Player is manifesting powers that can only come from an alien influence. This alarms her.

Dialog.text: Dr. Yu's one of those creatures! Help!
Dialog.notes: [Rani Chaudhary] Player is manifesting powers that can only come from an alien influence. This alarms her.

Dialog.text: Leave it to TranStar to answer one attack with another...
No way am I going to sell you out. Your brother, however...
If Dahl tries to get in here, he'll regret it.
If I see that bastard Dahl, I'll choke him out.
Can't get to us, so he tries to suffocate us? This Dahl's a coward.
Morning, Mr. Yu.
Morning, Ms. Yu.
These things can be tricky, you know?
Dialog.notes: (Patricia Varma) Working on fixing a machine. Small grunt of exertion.

Dialog.text: Heard there's a chopper on the roof. Must be for you.
You'll have to take the elevator.
Down the hall. But you know that... I guess.
Aren't you going to be late?
You're supposed to keep going.
You're going to get me in trouble.
I can't talk to you anymore.
Captain. Did I- I thought...
Dialog.notes: [Marietta Kyrkos] Waking from sleep. A little stunned.

Dialog.text: Is everything okay?
Right away, Captain.
